definition: to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
while the connoisseur recognizes the artistry, the layman simply enjoys the show
pinyin: nei4 hang2 kan4 men2 dao5 , wai4 hang2 kan4 re4 nao5
containing_words.word: 内行看门道，外行看热闹

sentences.english: Dilettante watch the scene of bustle, adept guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 外行看热闹，内行看门道。
当这些人失败的时候，那些看热闹的旁人会感到高兴。

sentences.english: As they were wouking , a couple of older bous stopped by to watch, "What are you doing ?"
sentences.chinese: 他们干得正欢的时，两个大孩子停在一边看热闹。

sentences.english: A large group of citizens gathered to watch the commotion.
sentences.chinese: 一大群市民聚集起来看热闹。

sentences.english: Every quarter of an hour the railway brought fresh accessions of sightseers .
sentences.chinese: 坦帕铁路每隔一刻钟载来一批看热闹的群众。

sentences.english: Rubber-necking at accidents on the opposite side of the road seem to cause most of the senseless traffic jams.
sentences.chinese: 对向车道看热闹的人引起了最多无意义的交通堵塞。

sentences.english: I heard noise and I went outside to see what happened.
sentences.chinese: 我一听到的爆炸声，就跑到外面去看热闹。

sentences.english: Do not go sightseeing through areas of damage. You will only  hamper the relief effort.
sentences.chinese: 不要穿越受灾区域去看热闹，这样只会妨碍救援行动。

sentences.english: As the saying goes, dilettante watch the scene of bustle, expert looks at the way.
sentences.chinese: 俗话说，外行看热闹，内行看门道。

sentences.english: Do not go sightseeing through areas of damage. You will only hamper the relief effort.
sentences.chinese: 不要穿越受灾区域去看热闹，这样只会妨碍救援行动。

sentences.english: There were only the passersby on the side watching the excitement and making comments.
sentences.chinese: 只有一帮闲人帮旁边看热闹指点江山。

sentences.english: Because many of them are cuirious, and shouted the sarcastic slogans.
sentences.chinese: 因为很多人都是看热闹的心态，还大喊讥讽性的口号。

sentences.english: In no case will they look on passively.
sentences.chinese: 他们决不会在一边看热闹。

sentences.english: The road is alive with lookers on.
sentences.chinese: 路上看热闹的人熙熙攘攘。

definition: to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to stand in a circle and watch
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
clamorous/noisy/sensational/very exciting
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to make an (unnecessary) racket (idiom)
to disperse in confusion (idiom)
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
not to understand the situation/unaware of the ins and outs
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
